concept.title: HTTP Protocols
concept.shortdesc: You can configure the to use HTTP or HTTPS. By default the uses HTTP.

conbody.p: HTTPS requires an SSL certificate. The provides a self-signed certificate so you can use HTTPS immediately. You can also generate a certificate that is self-signed or signed by a certifying authority. Web browsers generally issue a warning for self-signed certificates.
When you configure the to use HTTPS, you have the redirect HTTP requests to HTTPS or to ignore them.

When you generate a SSL certificate, use the following files:
keystore file A file that contains the private key and self-signed certificates for the web server. You can create your own keystore file or use the keystore file provided by the . Store the keystore file in the following location:<SDCinstalldir>/etc The default keystore file is sdc-keystore.jks.
keystore password file A file that contains the password to open the Java keystore file. You can create your own keystore password file or use the file provided by the . Store the keystore password file in the following location:<SDCinstalldir>/etc The default keystore file is sdc-keystore-password.txt.
